notes: In 1925, Dart insured the fossil skull through Joseph Liddle Financial & Insurance Agents located in Johannesburg for the travel and transit of the fossil, itself.
The National Museum of Ireland, Royal Albert Memorial Museum, University of Glasgow, and even the Perth Museum & Art Gallery still display fossil casts by R.F. Damon & Company.

In addition to creating casts, Mr. Damon also facilitated the sale of original fossil specimens between private sellers, natural historians, and national museums. The Natural History Archives in London, for example, denote that in addition to creating casts, Damon Sr. enabled the sale of American Silurian fossils by American seller, Paul Mohr, to the Natural History Museum, itself. Dorset County Museum still has collections of actual fossils acquired from R.F. Damon (Sr.)â€”mostly fossils from the Portland Limestone Group of Portland, Dorset.
Mr. F. O. Barlow to Dr. Raymond Dart, 15 July 1933, Raymond Dart Archive, University of Witwatersrand.

Specific museums include: Aberdeen Museum, Munich Anthropological Institute, Munich Paleontological Institute, Edinburgh Royal Society Museum, Society Jersoaise (for Professor Boule), Cardiff Medical School, Ipswich Museum, Cambridge Anatomy School, Columbia University, Oxford University Museum, Pittsburg, London University College, Amsterdam, Sheffield University, and Cape Town University.
